docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Olympic Committee told U.S. sports federations that athletes and staff concerned for their health over the Zika virus should consider not going to the Rio 2016 Olympic Games in August.

headline.main: Exclusive-U.S. Athletes Should Consider Not Attending Olympics if Fear Zika-Officials
headline.print_headline: Exclusive-U.S. Athletes Should Consider Not Attending Olympics if Fear Zika-Officials

docs.snippet: The United States Olympic Committee told U.S. sports federations that athletes and staff concerned for their health over the Zika virus should consider not going to the Rio 2016 Olympic Games in August.

docs.lead_paragraph: An epidemic gives Brazil an opening to address inequality — and abortion.

headline.main: The Zika Virus and Brazilian Women’s Right to Choose
headline.print_headline: Zika and a Woman’s Right to Choose

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by law professor Debora Diniz argues Zika virus outbreak presents Brazil with chance to address country's economic and gender inequality; notes infection is found overwhelmingly among poor working women with little protection from mosquitoes and scant access to reproductive education and health services; calls for policy changes, especially on abortion, which empower underprivileged women.
docs.snippet: An epidemic gives Brazil an opening to address inequality — and abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Policy experts say new provisions in Obamacare offer an opportunity to treat maternal depression, and a counselor calls for more treatment options.

headline.main: Help for Depressed Mothers, and Their Children
headline.print_headline: Help for Depressed Mothers, and Their Children

docs.snippet: Policy experts say new provisions in Obamacare offer an opportunity to treat maternal depression, and a counselor calls for more treatment options.
